detailsOfAchievement: Maahi socio cultural society - one of the leading Hindi theatre groups in the country stands committed to aesthetically innovative and socially relevant theatre. Maahi has carved a niche for itself in the Indian theatre scene by staging plays of varied socio political interest while not losing out mass appeal. The group takes up contemporary issues to underline the contours of our time while providing the best of entertainment. The group has many productions to its credit. All these plays have been directed by Maahi Resident Director Nizam Patel. For Maahi, theatre has a purpose of awakening the audience to contemporary issue and creating a dialogue on prevailing social problems. Maahi Theatre group also involve in street Theatre Movement. Group performed more than 25 street plays on different Socio -political issues .Maahi socio cultural society " is a group of young energetic people from the filed of media, art etc .main plays our daayan,thag,zikr e meer,eidgah,ek ladki panch deewane,moorkh guru ke murkh chaile etc ..

detailsOfAchievement: An entrepreneur can also raise money from their friends and family members to start their business. This allows an entrepreneur to have access to a greater sum of money, without the losing any control of the company. Such investment by friends and family generally takes place on a personal level and the entrepreneur often does not pay any interest on the amount he has raised

sourceOfFunds.purpose: One of the easiest and surest ways of starting up and being an entrepreneur is to invest your own money in the business. Your own money has no strings attached to it and you can pretty much do what you want to. A business can be self funded through personal savings, but it does have some limitations. You may not have the optimum amount of money needed to start the business and the risk of using your savings to fund a business that may or may not work is always risky.

During the year 2014-15 Matra Shakti Sewa Mahila Mandal provided trainings to 925 women.

detailsOfAchievement: Our Vision A fuller human life for the poorest of poor Our Mission Help to develop human resource for marginalized. Information on MWTCW: Registration Details Sr. Type of Registration 1 Society [No.JJ-6696 dated 01/04/2003] 2 FCRA No- 063310066 3 12-A - awaited 4 80G - awaited MWTCWs Registered Office: 1326, Forth Bridge, Napier Town Jabalpur Mobile No.9300119459, 9826144351 Email ID- clayton_arti@yahoo.co.in Branch Office: 386, G-3, Mohini River View, Sarvadharma, B-Sector, Bhopal (MP) Mobile No.9300119459, 9826144351 Our Bank: State Bank of India, Jabalpur (MP) UTI Bank Ltd. Jabalpur (MP)  for FCRA account Strategy MWTCW works through the intermediacy of NGOs development agencies, government functionaries, professionals and all persons who are concerned about the futures of rural people through the rural facilitators it trains. DETAILS OF ACTIVITIES DURING THE PERIOD 1 APRIL, 2009TO 31 MARCH 2010 Health and Hygiene Campaign: By organizing health and hygiene week, MWTCW spread the awareness in general public and especially in slum about the health and hygiene practices. What are the safe hygiene practices, why are they needed and what benefit one get, were told to them. The simple slogan Health is Wealth was made popular among the children. They were advised to cut their nails regularly and brush their teeth every morning were small but most important massages for them. The parents were advised to take care of their children by imbibing such normal but hygienic habits in them. World Environment Day MWTCW organized the World Environment Day and invited the Mayor and general people to take the part in it. The saplings of various varieties were distributed among people and they were encouraged to plant the saplings in their households and surrounding to support the environment. It was vary encouraging to note that a grand public support was received during the event. World Woman;s Day MWTCW organized International Womens Day on March 08, 2009 and appropriate messages were disseminated with the general public and school children so that they can understand the importance of the day Rural Sanitation program: MWTCW visited the nearby villages and organized the meetings with farmers groups. They were advised regarding personal hygiene and sanitation practices. The mothers were encouraged to keep the surrounding clean and insist the establish toilets in their houses. Program on Malaria Control: This year also we run a program on malaria control. We visited the same villages which we had been visited last year. We met the public and were satisfied to know that most of the people have taken our message serious and now use the mosquito net to prevent from bite of mosquitoes. Reproductive & Child Health Program: Once again to spread the awareness among the pregnant and lactating women, MWTCW organized the reproductive and child health awareness campaign. The women were advised to take IFA tablets, TT vaccine and also get immunized their children appropriately and on time. Awareness on environment: The meetings have been organized with the villager to encourage them to protect the environment. They were told not to cut the trees and also were encouraged to use organic fertilizers; vermin compost etc. to bring an in improvement in their fields. Computer trainings: For the benefit of tribal youths, MWTCW organized the computer training program in computer operation. They student ( both male and female) were taught about MS word, Excel, Access, power point etc. Nursery development: MWTCW encouraged the village to grow kitchen gardens. They were encouraged to plant the fruit trees and other saplings such as Amla, guava, papaya. This they can do even their courtyards or in their angan and even the female in the family can take care of them. This is also a good source of income as well as getting the health benefit by its consumption. Vocational training programs: MWTCW arranged the trainings for the child youth and encouraged them to take part in it. The girls were encouraged to join beauty culture and hair dressing classes to learn the skills. They were taught about the pedicure and manicure, various types of skin and its treatment, hairdressing styles etc. They were advised how to deal with the customer and were encouraged to get the proficiency in this field. Environment Protection & Plantation Program: On the occasion of Environment protection day (5th June) our organization MWTCW has been cultivated 500 plants in 50 different dry places where the planting was really found the project was funded by YMCA cantt. Jabalpur. Environment awareness Program: Program on environment Protection & awareness was organized in swarsati engineering college for engineering students in there campus by MWTCW in the month of august the project was funded by Sarda Shiksha Samiti Jabalpur.

detailsOfAchievement: Organization Molecular welfare society is Participating in social welfare activities and functioning in up-liftment of underprivileged and people in distress like people with disability, prolonged sickness of TB and un- employed Youths, Health and support activities for Old aged/ Senior Citizens. The Organization has participated in Government sponsored programe of district Urban Development Authority Designated by state Government of Madhya Pradesh for SJSRY program since 2009 to 2012 and Participation in National Rural Livelihood Mission Project on District Poverty Alliviation ( DPIP). The Organization has good experience of formation of SHG/JLGin Rural and urban out reached areas of Gwalior and Chambal Division. also in District Rewa, Indore.The Beneficiaries has undergone Skill building Training on Livelihood Aspects, focussed attention being paid as Hand holding support for placement, Self- employment generation and back word & forward Linkages for marketing, with Financial Institution for required support. Organization is actively Carrying activities on free coaching, IIT-JEE, PET & PMT Coaching for Youths. Society is a registered Vocational Training Provider By DGE&T Govt of India to provide Vocational Training on MES Trades. Main Objective of the Organization are- Sustainable development of Excluded Communities & Women. To Encourage and Enhance the Cadre of Youths by Providing Coaching for entrance Examination for better and higher Prospects and Self reliance. Hand holding support to rural entrepreneures for employment generation and placement after skill development .
